data.title: Loved it
data.text: This is absolutely the best authentic Mexican food in Lubbock.  The service is also fantastic along with the atmosphere.  I would fathom a guess that you would love this place too.

data.title: Loved it
data.text: At 2 pm there was a line. But a short wait.   Cold beers fast service. Loved the food.  Very tasty but not spicy.   After a road trip from Amarillo this was a perfect intro to Lubbock.  Wish we had gone back it was so good.

data.title: Great food Good Price
data.text: My family must of ate 6 trays of their chips and hot sauce. Guns Up for the chips.  I can't remember what all we ate but everything was great. The service was excellent too.

data.title: Queso is perfect!
data.text: I could have just queso for my meal-it is that good. Everything here is amazing. You won't regret it! Plus they are fast!

data.title: Fantastic breakfast
data.text: What a delightful find for good Mexican breakfast.  It's a very busy place but go right it.  Had the chillaques with steak and the migas and both were perfect and delicious.  We also got a small bowl of Pozole' which was scrumptious.   Great breakfast joint!

data.title: WONDERFUL!
data.text: The shrimp and avocado dish was to die for! Great chips and salsa as well. Their homemade tortillas are amazing. Give Jalisco's a try- you'll love it!

data.title: A full service menu
data.text: Surprised to find it open on Labour Day, my daughter and I were also surprised to find a full menu and sitdown service, not at all a fast food place.  Menu was varied, prices were reasonable, and food was absolutely delicious.  My only complaint was with the cd juke box;  the sound was painfully too loud

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Jalisco's is well worth wait, food is always excellent and is quality. Wait staff are courteous and attentive.

data.title: Meal after a xc school trip.
data.text: I took my XC kids to have dinner here after a race in Lubbock. They loved it! The atmosphere was nice, good inexpensive food, nice waitresses and my kids actually practiced using their spanish a bit.

data.title: better than great
data.text: great food, great service - one of the only "real" mexican food restaurants in town.  oh - did i mention the tortillas? the chips? the salsa? they are great!  not one bad item on the menu- you always leave with a full belly and a big smile.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Super amazing food for amazing prices. Compare to other Mexican food & this is the Best Buy!!! & the best taste in town! We go there often & they are FAST with our fresh food. iPads have made their business more efficient!!! They are amazing!

data.title: Excellant Food Good Service
data.text: I think I have eaten the same dish four times now and each time it is the same-delicious.  The beverage cups are large so the chances of running out are pretty slim.  Portion sizes are also larger than most with their meals so you almost always going to leave full.  Very consistant.

data.title: Ay Yi Yi !!
data.text:
Ahhhhhhhh, Taqueria Jalisco!!! I wish I could tell you how awesome all the food is there but I can't because I always always always order the same exact meal, everytime; TACOS CARNE ASADA!!!  Soft and hot corn tortillas, seasoned flank steak, onions, cilantro and with a little bit of lime juice plus a side order of Guacamole YUM!!  Oh! and of course - can't forget a nice cold DOS X. Ay yi yi !!

Attentive staff, friendly and courteous.  Reasonable prices.  Will caution you, sometimes the jukebox is like really blasting but what the hey, when in Rome right, so enjoy the experience.  Place is usually extremely busy, but oh so worth the wait.  Buen Provecho Ya'll

data.title: The Best Mexican Food in Lubbock
data.text: Taqueria Jalisco is a hidden jewel.   Best in Lubbock.    From seafood to street tacos to traditional tacos and enchiladas you just can't beat the food, the prices, the service, and the atmosphere.   Salvador and Nadia are the best.   Ask for them.   All types of Mexican Beers and great margaritas.    Try it out!!!!

data.title: Fantastic Food
data.text: Great food at a reasonable price! Being from San Antonio, where we have some of the best Mexican food in the US, my expectations were not high. I was very surprised how great the food was and would rate it as some of the best Mexican food I have had.

data.title: My favorite uber casual Mexican in the LBK
data.text:
TO be honest I passed this place probably hundreds of times before taking a chance and diving in. And I can not believe what I was missing. True and honest MC/Guadalajara style Mexican done like you were visiting your long lost auntie deep in Mexico somewhere and turned up here. Plates are not huge, but filling. Sauces are perfectly seasoned to reflect the type of protein it si being served with.

When ever I try a new restaurant, I always try the basics first. If they can get those right, then the rest of the menu is worth discovering later. Simplicity it was for my first visit:

Soft chicken tacos
Crisp beef tacos
Bean and beef burrito with red sauce
Tamale
and a simple cheese enchilada.

Absolutely delicious. Beef has seasoning that still lets you taster the meat, but lets you know it is Mexican. Chicken simmered long and pulled by hand. Tamale was the perfect balance of corn, beef and seasoning and just the right amount of moisture. My burrito was fantastic. I love perfectly executed runny beans. Who needs beans like peanut butter? These are the perfect compliment to a warm tortilla, beef and a nice red sauce and cheese inside.

The staff is no nonsense and hard working. The clientele is honest, hard working primarily Latino with a sprinkling of everyone else. The interior could use a little love and updating, but hey, if it means they food might suffer, then leave it be!

data.title: Not what I expected..
data.text: Friendly service when checked on. Food was not at all what I expected. It didn't have a good flavor at all. Made me wish I saved Mexican food craving for back home as there was nothing I found good about this place. I ordered a gordita and it looked like a poor excuse for a weird looking burger.

data.title: Authentic Mexican
data.text: This is authentic Mexican food in Lubbock, Texas. Service is quick and food is delicious. The price is reasonable for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

data.title: Mrs.
data.text: We stopped in Lubbock on our way to San Antonio . This is an authentic Mexican restaurant. The ambiance was very nice. The service was excellent. The food was delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the area.

data.title: Real food, not Tex/Mex
data.text: Makes you think you are in Mexico. Real Mexican food. Incredibly good margaritas. If you expect chimichangas and boat drinks, this isn't your place. Plastic table covers, kids everywhere, Latino music blaring from a jukebox, construction workers, musicians, and beauty queens:  you never know what or who will be seen here. Food is good. Solid Mexican. Service is equally good.
